          for CBL required for lysosomal sorting.
        supporting_text: Phosphorylation at tyrosine Y1069 (i.e. Y1045 in the 
          mature protein) of EGFR creates a major docking site for E3 
          ubiquitin-protein ligase, CBL (Casitas B-lineage lymphoma proto- 
          oncogene) and  is required to sort the EGFR to lysosomes for 
          degradation.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-183058
    title: Phosphorylation of CBL (EGFR:GRB2:CBL)
    findings:
      - statement: EGF stimulation leads to CBL phosphorylation on Tyr-371, 
          enabling ubiquitin ligase activity.
        supporting_text: EGF (and indeed FGF, PDGF and NGF) stimulation results 
          in CBL phosphorylation on Tyr-371. Phosphorylation is necessary for 
          CBL to exhibit ubiquitin ligase activity.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-183067
    title: Localization of CBL:GRB2 to the membrane
    findings:
      - statement: EGFR phosphorylation after EGF stimulation allows GRB2 
          binding to phosphorylated tyrosines.
        supporting_text: Upon EGF stimulation and consequent EGFR 
          phosphorylation, GRB2 binds phosphorylated tyrosines
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-183072
    title: EGFR non-clathrin mediated endocytosis
    findings:
      - statement: At high ligand levels, EGFR undergoes clathrin-independent 
          endocytosis when Y1069 is phosphorylated and ubiquitinated.
        supporting_text: At higher concentrations of ligand, a substantial 
          fraction of the receptor (>50%) is endocytosed through a clathrin 
          independent, lipid-raft-dependent route as the receptor becomes Y1069 
          (i.e. Y1045 in the mature protein) phosphorylated and ubiquitnated.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-183084
    title: CBL escapes CDC42-mediated inhibition by down-regulating the adaptor 
      molecule Beta-Pix
    findings:
      - statement: Beta-Pix association with CBL is a critical step in 
          CDC42-mediated inhibition of EGFR ubiquitylation and downregulation.
        supporting_text: Beta-Pix (Cool-1) associates with CBL, which appears to
          be a critical step in CDC42-mediated inhibition of EGFR ubiquitylation
          and downregulation.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-183089
    title: CBL binds and ubiquitinates phosphorylated Sprouty
    findings:
      - statement: EGF stimulation promotes Sprouty phosphorylation and 
          CBL-mediated ubiquitination for degradation.
        supporting_text: Sprouty is ubiquitinated by CBL in an EGF-dependent 
          manner. EGF stimulation induces the tyrosine phosphorylation of 
          Sprouty, which in turn enhances the interaction of Sprouty with CBL.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-1963563
    title: MATK (CSK homologous kinase) binds phosphorylated ERBB2
    findings:
      - statement: MATK binds ERBB2 at phosphorylated Y1253 to inhibit 
          downstream signaling.
        supporting_text: MATK (also known as CHK or CSK homologous kinase) binds
          to ERBB2 through phosphorylated tyrosine residue Y1253 in the C-tail 
          of ERBB2 and, through an unknown mechanism, inhibits ERBB2 downstream 
          signaling.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-1963581
    title: Trans-autophosphorylation of p-Y877-ERBB2 heterodimers
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 Y877 phosphorylation by SRC kinases increases the 
          trans-autophosphorylation rate of ERBB2 heterodimers.
        supporting_text: Phosphorylation of ERBB2 on tyrosine residue Y877 by 
          SRC family kinases significantly increases trans-autophosphorylation 
          rate of ERBB2 heterodimers, presumably by enabling the kinase domain 
          of ERBB2 to achieve a conformation that positively affects ERBB2 
          kinase activity.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-1963582
    title: Trans-autophosphorylation of ERBB2 heterodimers
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 and EGF-bound EGFR heterodimers trans-autophosphorylate
          on multiple tyrosines to activate signaling.
        supporting_text: Dimers of ERBB2 and EGF-bound EGFR 
          trans-autophosphorylate on six EGFR tyrosine residues and six ERBB2 
          tyrosine residues to form phosphorylated heterodimers that activate 
          downstream signaling cascades (Ricci et al. 1995, Pinkas-Kramarski et 
          al. 1996, Walton et al. 1990, Margolis et al. 1989, Hazan et al. 1990,
          Helin et al. 1991).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-1963586
    title: SRC family kinases phosphorylate ERBB2
    findings:
      - statement: After ERBB2 heterodimerization, SRC family kinases 
          phosphorylate ERBB2 Y877, enhancing kinase activity.
        supporting_text: Dissociation of HSP90 from ERBB2 upon formation of 
          ERBB2 heterodimers (with either EGFR, ERBB3 or ERBB4) enables 
          phosphorylation of ERBB2 on the tyrosine residue Y877, mediated by one
          of SRC family kinases  - SRC, FYN or YES1.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-1963589
    title: 'ERBB2 forms heterodimers with ligand-activated ERBB receptors: EGFR, ERBB3
      and ERBB4'
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 is activated by heterodimerization with 
          ligand-activated EGFR, ERBB3, or ERBB4.
        supporting_text: ERBB2, which does not bind any known ligand, is 
          activated through formation of a heterodimer with another 
          ligand-activated ERBB family member.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-1977959
    title: ERBB4 forms heterodimers with EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: Ligand-stimulated ERBB4 forms heterodimers with 
          ligand-stimulated EGFR that undergo trans-autophosphorylation.
        supporting_text: Heterodimers of ERBB4 and EGFR undergo 
          trans-autophosphorylation, but the exact phosphorylation pattern, 
          downstream signaling and physiological significance of these 
          heterodimers have not been studied (Riese et al. 1995, Cohen et al. 
          1996).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-212706
    title: Phospholipase C-gamma1 binds to the activated EGF receptor
    findings:
      - statement: Inactive PLCG1 binds activated EGFR.
        supporting_text: Inactive phospholipase C-gamma1 (PLCG1) binds to 
          activated epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-212710
    title: EGFR activates PLC-gamma1 by phosphorylation
    findings:
      - statement: EGFR phosphorylates PLCG1 to activate it.
        supporting_text: EGFR phosphorylates PLC-gamma1, thus activating it.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-212713
    title: Active PLC-gamma1 dissociates from EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: Activated PLCG1 dissociates from EGFR as a release step 
          before hydrolyzing PIP2.
        supporting_text: Once activated PLC-gamma1 dissociates from EGFR, it can
          hydrolyze PIP2.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-212718
    title: EGFR interacts with phospholipase C-gamma
    findings:
      - statement: Activated EGFR activates PLCG1 to hydrolyze PIP2 into IP3 and
          DAG.
        supporting_text: Activated EGFR can activate phospholipase C-gamma1 
          (PLC-gamma1, i.e. PLCG1) which hydrolyses phosphatidylinositol 
          4,5-bisphosphate (PIP2) to inositol 1,4,5-triphosphate (IP3) and 
          diacylglycerol (DAG).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-2179387
    title: Mature HBEGF binds to EGFR, triggering dimerisation and 
      autophosphorylation of the receptor
    findings:
      - statement: HBEGF binds and activates EGFR/ErbB1 and ErbB4.
        supporting_text: The heparin-binding EGF growth factor (HBEGF) is a 
          member of the EGF family of growth factors that binds to and activates
          the EGF receptor EGFR/ErbB1 and ErbB4 (not shown here) (Higashiyama et
          al. 1991, Elenius et al. 1997).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-2179407
    title: SOS1-mediated nucleotide exchange of RAS (HB-EFG-initiated)
    findings:
      - statement: SOS1 activates RAS by promoting GDP-GTP exchange.
        supporting_text: SOS1 activates RAS nucleotide exchange from the 
          inactive form (bound to GDP) to an active form (bound to GTP) (Chardin
          et al. 1993).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-2179415
    title: GRB2:SOS1 binds to HBEGF:p-Y-EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: GRB2 binds activated EGFR while in complex with SOS, at Y1068
          and/or Y1086.
        supporting_text: One such protein, growth factor receptor-bound protein 
          2 (GRB2), can bind activated EGFR with its SH2 domain whilst in 
          complex with SOS through its SH3 domain. GRB2 can bind at either Y1068
          and/or Y1086 autophosphorylation sites on the receptor (Batzer et al. 
          1994, Okutani et al. 1994).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-2316434
    title: PI3K phosphorylates PIP2 to PIP3
    findings:
      - statement: PI3K can be activated downstream of EGFR and other RTKs.
        supporting_text: PI3K can be activated downstream of receptor tyrosine 
          kinases (RTKs) such as FGFR (Ong et al. 2001, Eswarakumar et al. 
          2005), KIT (Chian et al. 2001, Ronnstrand 2004, Reber et al. 2006), 
          PDGF (Coughlin et al. 1989, Fantl et al. 1992, Heldin et al. 1998), 
          insulin receptor IGF1R (Hadari et al. 1992, Kooijman et al. 1995), and
          EGFR and its family members (Rodrigues et al. 2000, Jackson et al. 
          2004, Kainulainen et al. 2000, Junttila et al. 2009).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-2400009
    title: PI3K inhibitors block PI3K catalytic activity
    findings:
      - statement: Multiple inhibitors have been developed that block the 
          phosphoinositide kinase activity of PI3K.
        supporting_text: A variety of inhibitors capable of blocking the 
          phosphoinositide kinase activity of PI3K have been developed.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-445069
    title: L1-EGFR trans-heterodimerization
    findings:
      - statement: L1CAM-EGFR trans interaction induces EGFR kinase activity, 
          but autophosphorylation requires additional cis interactions.
        supporting_text: L1CAM and EGFR engage in a weak heterophilic trans 
          interaction and this induces EGFR tyrosine kinase activity and its 
          activation. However, this trans interaction alone is not sufficient to
          induce EGFR autophosphorylation, which requires additional cis type 
          interactions between the two proteins.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637764
    title: Binding of GRB2:GAB1 complex to p-EGFRvIII mutant
    findings:
      - statement: GRB2:GAB1 binding to phosphorylated EGFRvIII is assumed and 
          not directly tested.
        supporting_text: Direct binding of the GRB2:GAB1 complex to 
          phosphorylated homodimers of EGFRvIII cancer mutant has not been 
          tested.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637765
    title: Binding of PI3K to complex of GRB2:GAB1 and p-EGFRvIII
    findings:
      - statement: EGFRvIII is assumed to recruit the PI3K complex similarly to 
          wild-type EGFR.
        supporting_text: EGFRvIII cancer mutant is assumed to recruit the PI3K 
          complex PIK3CA:PIK3R1 in a manner similar to wild-type EGFR (Rodrigues
          et al. 2000).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637766
    title: Binding of SHC1 to p-5Y-EGFRvIII
    findings:
      - statement: SHC1 binding to EGFRvIII is assumed based on its binding to 
          phosphorylated EGFR Y1148 and Y1173.
        supporting_text: Binding of SHC1 to EGFRvIII cancer mutant has not been 
          tested but SHC1 is assumed to bind EGFRvIII in the same way it binds 
          wild-type EGFR.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637770
    title: Binding of GRB2:SOS1 complex to phosphorylated EGFRvIII
    findings:
      - statement: Direct binding of GRB2:SOS1 to phosphorylated EGFRvIII has 
          not been tested, but GRB2 binds Y1068 and Y1086.
        supporting_text: Direct binding of GRB2:SOS1 complex to phosphorylated 
          homodimers of EGFRvIII cancer mutant has not been tested.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637792
    title: PLC-gamma 1 binds to p-EGFRvIII mutant
    findings:
      - statement: EGFRvIII phosphorylates Y992 and is expected to recruit PLCG1
          like wild-type EGFR.
        supporting_text: Tyrosine residue Y992 (corresponding to Y1016 when 
          counting from the first amino acid of the EGFR precursor, prior to 
          cleavage of the 24-amino acid signal peptide at the N-terminus), a 
          docking site for PLC-gamma 1 (PLCG1), is phosphorylated in EGFRvIII 
          cancer mutant and expected to recruit PLC-gamma 1 in the same way as 
          the wild-type EGFR receptor (Grandal et al. 2007).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637794
    title: EGFRvIII does not bind CBL
    findings:
      - statement: EGFRvIII lacks Y1069 phosphorylation and shows little or no 
          CBL binding.
        supporting_text: In EGFRvIII mutant, Y1069 (i.e. Y1045 in the mature 
          protein) is not phosphorylated (Han et al. 2006, Grandal et al. 2007).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637795
    title: Phosphorylation of PLC-gamma 1 by p-EGFRvIII mutant
    findings:
      - statement: EGFRvIII is assumed to phosphorylate PLCG1 after recruitment,
          as in wild-type EGFR.
        supporting_text: Once recruited, PLC-gamma 1 is assumed to be 
          phosphorylated by EGFRvIII cancer mutant in the same way it is 
          phosphorylated by the wild-type EGFR (Meisenhelder et al. 1989, Wahl 
          et al. 1990).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637796
    title: Phosphorylation of SHC1 by p-5Y-EGFRvIII
    findings:
      - statement: EGFRvIII phosphorylation of SHC1 is assumed based on 
          wild-type EGFR behavior.
        supporting_text: EGFRvIII cancer mutant was not directly tested for its 
          ability to phosphorylate SHC1, but is assumed to interact with SHC1 in
          the same way as the wild-type EGFR protein (Soler et al. 1994, 
          VanderKuur et al. 1995).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637798
    title: Phosphorylated SHC1 in complex with p-5Y-EGFRvIII recruits GRB2:SOS1 
      complex
    findings:
      - statement: GRB2:SOS1 recruitment by SHC1 bound to EGFRvIII is assumed 
          and not directly tested.
        supporting_text: Recruitment of GRB2:SOS1 complex by SHC1 bound to 
          phosphorylated dimers of EGFRvIII cancer mutant has not been directly 
          tested, but is assumed to happen in the same way it happens with the 
          SHC1 bound to the phosphorylated homodimer of wild-type EGFR (Chardin 
          et al. 1993).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637800
    title: Dissociation of phosphorylated PLC-gamma 1 from p-EGFRvIII mutant
    findings:
      - statement: Phosphorylated PLCG1 is expected to dissociate from EGFRvIII 
          as a release step before downstream signaling.
        supporting_text: Once phosphorylated, PLC-gamma 1 is expected to 
          dissociate from phosphorylated EGFRvIII cancer mutant and induce 
          downstream signaling in the same way it does when activated by the 
          wild-type EGFR.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637801
    title: Conversion of PIP2 to PIP3 by PI3K bound to phosphorylated EGFRvIII
    findings:
      - statement: EGFRvIII is assumed to induce PI3K/AKT signaling via 
          PI3K-mediated conversion of PIP2 to PIP3.
        supporting_text: The kinase activity of PI3K mediates the 
          phosphorylation of PIP2 to form PIP3. It is assumed that EGFRvIII 
          cancer mutant induces PI3K/AKT signaling in a manner similar to 
          wild-type EGFR.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637806
    title: SOS-mediated nucleotide exchange of RAS (mediated by GRB2:SOS1 in 
      complex with p-EGFRvIII)
    findings:
      - statement: SOS1 is assumed to activate RAS downstream of EGFRvIII via 
          GRB2, with RAS-MAPK activation observed in EGFRvIII cells.
        supporting_text: Based on the wild-type EGFR signaling, it is assumed 
          that the guanine nucleotide exchange factor SOS1 interacts with 
          phosphorylated EGFRvIII mutant through the adaptor protein, GRB2. Upon
          formation of this complex, SOS1 activates RAS by promoting GDP release
          and GTP binding.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5637808
    title: SOS-mediated nucleotide exchange of RAS (mediated by GRB2:SOS1 in 
      complex with phosphorylated SHC1 and p-EGFRvIII)
    findings:
      - statement: SOS1 recruited by GRB2 bound to p-SHC1:p-EGFRvIII is assumed 
          to activate RAS.
        supporting_text: SOS1, recruited by GRB2 bound to p-SHC1:p-EGFRvIII 
          mutant, is assumed to activate RAS nucleotide exchange from the 
          inactive form (bound to GDP) to an active form (bound to GTP).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5638137
    title: EGFRvIII cancer variant does not bind EGF ligand
    findings:
      - statement: EGFRvIII lacks the ligand-binding domain and cannot bind EGFR
          ligands.
        supporting_text: EGFRvIII mutant lacks the ligand binding domain and is 
          therefore unable to bind EGFR ligands (Fernandes et al. 2001).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-5672965
    title: RAS GEFs promote RAS nucleotide exchange
    findings:
      - statement: RAS GEFs promote GDP-GTP exchange on membrane-associated RAS 
          in response to signaling.
        supporting_text: The human genome is predicted to encode 27 RAS guanine 
          nucleotide exchange factors (GEFs) that promote the exchange of GDP 
          for GTP on membrane-associated RAS in response to RAS-MAPK pathway 
          activation by growth factors, hormones, cytokines and other stimuli 
          (reviewed in Cherfils and Zeghouf, 2013; Cargnello and Roux, 2011).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-6785636
    title: Phosphorylated ERBB2 heterodimers bind MEMO1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 phosphorylated at Y1222 binds MEMO1.
        supporting_text: ERBB2 phosphorylated on tyrosine residue Y1222 binds 
          MEMO1 (mediator of ERBB2-driven cell motility) (Marone et al. 2004, 
          Qiu et al. 2008, Zaoui et al. 2010, Feracci et al. 2011).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-6785648
    title: MEMO1 binds RHOA:GTP:DIAPH1
    findings:
      - statement: MEMO1 associated with phosphorylated ERBB2 heterodimers binds
          the RHOA:GTP:DIAPH1 complex.
        supporting_text: MEMO1, in complex with phosphorylated ERBB2 
          heterodimers, associates with the complex of activated RHOA and formin
          family member DIAPH1.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8847995
    title: Activated ERBB2 binds PTK6 (BRK)
    findings:
      - statement: PTK6 (BRK) binds activated ERBB2.
        supporting_text: PTK6 (BRK) is a nonreceptor tyrosine kinase that can 
          bind activated ERBB2 receptor (Xiang et al. 2008).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8848005
    title: ERBB2 promotes PTK6 autophosphorylation
    findings:
      - statement: PTK6 binding to activated ERBB2 stimulates PTK6 Y342 
          autophosphorylation, increasing catalytic activity.
        supporting_text: Binding of PTK6 (BRK) to activated ERBB2 receptor 
          stimulates autophosphorylation of PTK6 on tyrosine residue Y342 (Xiang
          et al. 2008, Peng et al. 2015). Autophosphorylation at Y342 
          significantly increases catalytic activity of PTK6 (Qiu and Miller 
          2002).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8857549
    title: HBEGF-bound EGFR forms a heterodimer with GPNMB
    findings:
      - statement: HBEGF-bound EGFR forms heterodimers with GPNMB via 
          interaction of the GPNMB intracellular domain with the EGFR kinase 
          domain.
        supporting_text: EGFR bound to HBEGF (HB-EGF) can form heterodimers with
          the transmembrane glycoprotein GPNBM. The intracellular domain of 
          GPNMB interacts with the kinase domain of EGFR (Lin et al. 2016).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8857555
    title: EGFR phosphorylates GPNMB
    findings:
      - statement: HBEGF-bound EGFR phosphorylates GPNMB at Y525.
        supporting_text: HBEGF-bound EGFR phosphorylates its heterodimerization 
          partner GPNMB at tyrosine residue Y525 (Lin et al. 2016).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8857565
    title: Phosphorylated GPNMB recruits PTK6 and LRRK2 in the presence of 
      LINC01139
    findings:
      - statement: GPNMB phosphorylation at Y525 recruits PTK6 and LRRK2 in the 
          presence of LINC01139.
        supporting_text: Phosphorylation of GPNBM at tyrosine residue Y525 upon 
          heterodimerization with HBEGF-bound EGFR promotes, in the presence of 
          long non-coding RNA LINC011139 (LINK-A), the recruitment of PTK6 
          (BRK). In addition to PTK6, LINC01139 simultaneously recruits 
          serine/threonine kinase LRRK2 to phosphorylated GPNBM (Lin et al. 
          2016).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8857577
    title: LINC01139 facilitates PTK6 autophosphorylation
    findings:
      - statement: LINC01139 induces a PTK6 conformational change that 
          facilitates PTK6 autophosphorylation on Y351.
        supporting_text: The long non-coding RNA LINC01139 (LINK-A) induces 
          conformational change of PTK6 (BRK), which facilitates PTK6 
          autophosphorylation on tyrosine residue Y351 and possibly other sites 
          (Lin et al. 2016).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8857583
    title: LINC01139 promotes phosphorylation of HIF1A by PTK6
    findings:
      - statement: PTK6 activated via LINC01139-mediated recruitment 
          phosphorylates HIF1A at Y565.
        supporting_text: PTK6 (BRK) tyrosine kinase, activated via long 
          non-coding RNA LINC01139 (LINK-A) mediated recruitment to 
          phosphorylated GPNMB (bound to HBEGF-activated EGFR), phosphorylates 
          hypoxia inducible factor 1 alpha (HIF1A) at tyrosine residue Y565.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8863804
    title: PTPN12 dephosphorylates ERBB2 on tyrosine Y1248
    findings:
      - statement: PTPN12 dephosphorylates ERBB2 Y1248, attenuating downstream 
          RAS activation.
        supporting_text: PTPN12 protein tyrosine phosphatase dephosphorylates 
          activated ERBB2 at tyrosine residue Y1248 and activated EGFR at 
          tyrosine residue Y1148 (Y1148 corresponds to Y1172 of the nascent 
          EGFR, with 24 amino acid signal peptide at the N-terminus). 
          PTPN12-mediated dephosphorylation of ERBB2 attenuates downstream RAS 
          activation, as Y1248 is involved in SHC1 recruitment.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8864029
    title: PTPN12 dephosphorylates EGFR at Y1172 (Y1148)
    findings:
      - statement: PTPN12 dephosphorylates EGFR Y1148 (Y1172), inhibiting SHC1 
          recruitment and downstream RAS activation.
        supporting_text: PTPN12-mediated dephosphorylation of activated EGFR 
          inhibits SHC1 recruitment to the p-Y1148 (i.e. p-Y1172) docking site, 
          thus attenuating downstream RAS activation (Sun et al. 2011).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8864105
    title: PTPN18 binds ERBB2:EGFR heterodimers
    findings:
      - statement: PTPN18 binds ERBB2 activated in response to EGF stimulation.
        supporting_text: PTPN18 protein tyrosine phosphatase (BDP1) binds ERBB2,
          activated in response to EGF stimulation, via PEST and catalytic 
          domains of PTPN18 (Wang et al. 2014).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8864125
    title: PTPN18 dephosphorylates ERBB2 at Y1196, Y1112 and Y1248
    findings:
      - statement: PTPN18 dephosphorylates ERBB2 Y1196, Y1112, and Y1248, 
          attenuating PI3K/AKT and RAS signaling.
        supporting_text: Dephosphorylation of ERBB2 tyrosines Y1196 and Y1248 
          attenuates downstream activation of PI3K/AKT and RAS signaling.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8866279
    title: Epsin family proteins bind ubiquitinated cargo
    findings:
      - statement: EGFR undergoes ubiquitination at the plasma membrane, 
          triggering endocytosis.
        supporting_text: A number of receptor tyrosine kinases, including EGFR, 
          VEGFR, FGFR and others undergo ubiquitination at the plasma membrane, 
          triggering endocytosis.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8867041
    title: EGFR phosphorylates EPS15
    findings:
      - statement: Activated EGFR phosphorylates EPS15 at Y849, influencing 
          endocytic routing.
        supporting_text: EPS15 is phosphorylated at Y849 by activated EGFR 
          (Confalonieri et al, 2000).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8867044
    title: EGFR binds EPS15, EPN1, EPS15L1
    findings:
      - statement: EPS15, EPN1, and EPS15L1 are required for endocytosis of 
          ligand-activated EGFR.
        supporting_text: EH-containing proteins such as EPS15, EPN1 and EPS15L1 
          are required for the endocytosis of ligand-activated EGFR 
          (Confalonieri et al, 2000; Huang et al, 2004; reviewed in van Bergen 
          en Henegouwen, 2009).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8867047
    title: PTPN3 dephosphorylates EPS15
    findings:
      - statement: PTPN3 dephosphorylates EPS15, promoting EGFR internalization 
          into caveolin-enriched structures.
        supporting_text: Overexpression of the phosphatase PTPN3, which 
          dephosphorylates EPS15 in vitro and in vivo, promotes the 
          internalization of EGFR into caveolin-enriched structures and targets 
          it for lysosomal degradation (Li et al, 2015).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8867754
    title: F- and N- BAR domain proteins bind the clathrin-coated pit
    findings:
      - statement: F-BAR domain proteins such as FCHo1 and FCHo2 are recruited 
          early to clathrin-coated pit formation by recognizing shallow membrane
          curvature.
        supporting_text: F-BAR domain proteins such as FCHo 1 and 2 recognize 
          shallow membrane curvature and are generally recruited early in the 
          formation of clathrin-coated pit (Itoh et al, 2005; Kamioka et al, 
          2004; Henne et al, 2007; Shimada et al, 2007; Henne et al, 2010).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8867756
    title: CLASP proteins and cargo are recruited to the nascent clathrin-coated
      pit
    findings:
      - statement: CLASP proteins are recruited to nascent clathrin-coated pits 
          via interactions with AP-2 and clathrin, bringing cargo into the pit.
        supporting_text: CLASP proteins are recruited to nascent clathrin-coated
          pits (CCPs) through interactions with AP-2 and clathrin.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8868071
    title: Clathrin recruits PIK3C2A
    findings:
      - statement: PIK3C2A binds clathrin and localizes to late-stage 
          clathrin-coated pits, where clathrin binding stimulates its kinase 
          activity.
        supporting_text: PIK3C2A interacts with clathrin through a 
          clathrin-binding domain in its unique N-terminal tail and localizes to
          late-stage clathrin-coated pits (Domin et al, 2000; Gaidarov et al, 
          2001; Gaidarov et al, 2005).  Binding to clathrin stimulates the 
          kinase activity of PIK3C2A and promotes the production of PI(3,4)P2 at
          the plasma membrane (Gaidarov et al, 2001).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8868072
    title: Clathrin-associated PIK3C2A phosphorylates PI(4)P to PI(3,4)P2
    findings:
      - statement: Clathrin-associated PIK3C2A converts PI(4)P to PI(3,4)P2, 
          promoting recruitment of BAR domain proteins such as SNX9.
        supporting_text: Clathrin-associated PIK3C2A catalyzes the conversion of
          PI(4)P to PI(3,4)P2, which contributes to the recruitment of BAR 
          domain proteins such as SNX9 to the clathrin-coated pit (Domin et al, 
          2000; Gaidarov et al, 2001; Gaidarov et al, 2005; Posor et al, 2013; 
          reviewed in Daumke et al, 2014).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8868230
    title: SNX9 recruits components of the actin polymerizing machinery
    findings:
      - statement: Actin is recruited late to clathrin-coated pits via ARP2/3 
          and N-BAR proteins such as SNX9 when required for vesicle formation.
        supporting_text: In cases where actin is required, it appears to be 
          recruited late to the emerging clathrin-coated pit, just prior to or 
          coincident with the recruitment of dynamin and vesicle scission 
          (Taylor et al, 2011; Taylor et al, 2012; reviewed in McMahon and 
          Boucrot, 2011).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8868236
    title: BAR domain proteins recruit dynamin
    findings:
      - statement: Dynamin self-assembly stimulates its GTPase activity to drive
          vesicle scission from the plasma membrane.
        supporting_text: dynamin self assembles into helical oligomers, 
          stimulating its GTPase activity
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8868648
    title: SYNJ hydrolyze PI(4,5)P2 to PI(4)P
    findings:
      - statement: SYNJ/OCRL hydrolyze PI(4,5)P2 to PI(4)P, aiding scission and 
          clathrin uncoating during endocytosis.
        supporting_text: Inositol-5-phosphatases like SYNJs and OCRL hydrolyze 
          PI(4,5)P2 to PI(4)P.  In the context of CME, this promotes the 
          abortive turnover (disassembly) of some CCPs, contributes to the 
          dynamin-mediated scission of the clathrin-coated vesicle neck, and 
          promotes clathrin uncoating following scission (Guan et al, 2010; 
          Cremona et al, 1999; Mani et al, 2007; Chang-Ileto et al, 2011; 
          Antonescu et al, 2011; reviewed in McMahon and Boucrot, 2011; Daumke 
          et al, 2014).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8868651
    title: Endophilins recruit synaptojanins to the clathrin-coated pit
    findings:
      - statement: Synaptojanins are recruited to clathrin-coated pits through 
          interactions with endophilins and other endocytic proteins.
        supporting_text: SYNJ proteins are recruited to the clathrin-coated pit 
          through interactions with a number of endocytic proteins including 
          ITSNs, EPS15, PACSIN proteins and endophilins, as well as with 
          clathrin and AP-2 (Haffner et al, 1997; Cestra et al, 1999; Maire et 
          al, 2004; Schuske et al, 2003; Verstreken et al, 2003; Modregger et 
          al, 2000; Perera et al 2006; Milosevic et al, 2011; reviewed in 
          Dittman and Ryan, 2009).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8868658
    title: HSPA8-mediated ATP hydrolysis promotes vesicle uncoating
    findings:
      - statement: HSPA8 ATP hydrolysis promotes dissociation of the clathrin 
          coat from vesicles.
        supporting_text: HSPA8 hydrolyzes ATP to promote dissociation of the 
          clathrin coat from the vesicle (reviewed in Sousa and Lafer, 2015).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8868659
    title: Clathrin recruits auxilins to the clathrin-coated vesicle
    findings:
      - statement: Auxilin proteins DNAJC6 and GAK are recruited to 
          clathrin-coated vesicles via clathrin and PI4P.
        supporting_text: After fission from the plasma membrane, auxilin 
          proteins DNAJC6 and GAK are recruited to the vesicle through 
          interaction with clathrin and phosphoinositides, in particular PI4P 
          (Greener et al, 2000; Lee et al, 2006; Massol et al, 2006; Taylor et 
          al, 2011; Scheele et al, 2001; Fotin et al, 2004a; Fotin et al, 2004b;
          Guan et al, 2010; reviewed in McMahon and Boucrot, 2011; Sousa and 
          Lafer, 2015).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8868660
    title: Auxilin recruits HSPA8:ATP to the clathrin-coated vesicle
    findings:
      - statement: Auxilin recruits HSPA8 (HSC70) to clathrin-coated vesicles 
          for uncoating.
        supporting_text: HSPA8 (also known as HSC70) is recruited to the 
          clathrin-coated vesicle through interaction with DNA J proteins GAK 
          and DNAJC6 (Rapoport et al, 2008; Xing et al, 2010; reviewed in Sousa 
          and Lafer, 2015).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8868661
    title: Dynamin-mediated GTP hydrolysis promotes vesicle scission
    findings:
      - statement: Dynamin GTP hydrolysis promotes membrane fission of 
          clathrin-coated vesicles.
        supporting_text: Self-assembly of dynamin around the neck of the 
          emerging clathrin-coated vesicle stimulates its GTPase activity. This 
          in turn promotes a conformational change in dynamin organization that 
          is required for membrane fission (Hinshaw and Schmid, 1995; Sweitzer 
          and Hinshaw, 1998; Takei et al, 1999; Yoshida et al, 2004; Chappie et 
          al, 2010;  Chappie et al, 2011; Ford et al, 2011; Faelber et al, 2011;
          reviewed in Daumke et al, 2014).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8869438
    title: Dissociation of clathrin-associated proteins
    findings:
      - statement: After clathrin coat removal, associated proteins dissociate 
          in a poorly understood step.
        supporting_text: After the removal of the clathrin coat, it is likely 
          that many of the proteins that contributed to vesicle formation are 
          lost, although the timing and mechanism of this step are poorly 
          understood (reviewed in McMahon and Boucrot, 2011; Lemmon, 2001).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8871193
    title: Dissociation of AAK1 and dephosphorylation of AP-2 mu2
    findings:
      - statement: GAPVD1 binding to AP-2 mu2 displaces AAK1 and promotes 
          dephosphorylation of AP-2 mu2, destabilizing AP-2 membrane 
          interactions.
        supporting_text: GAPVD1 binds the alpha adaptin ear domain of AP-2 mu2, 
          activating its RAB5-directed GEF activity and displacing AAK1.  AAK1 
          displacement results in a net dephosphorylation of the AP-2 mu2 
          subunit, destabilizing the interaction of AP-2 with the vesicle 
          membrane (Sato et al, 2005; Smerdjieva et al, 2008).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8871194
    title: RAB5 and GAPVD1 bind AP-2
    findings:
      - statement: RAB5 and GAPVD1 may promote AP-2 uncoating by displacing AAK1
          and dephosphorylating AP-2 mu2.
        supporting_text: RAB5 and its associated GEF GAPVD1 may contribute to 
          AP-2 uncoating by displacing AAK1 and promoting the net 
          dephosphorylation of the AP-2 mu2 subunit.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8874797
    title: EGFR gene expression is stimulated by TFAP2C
    findings:
      - statement: TFAP2C homodimers bind the EGFR promoter and stimulate EGFR 
          transcription.
        supporting_text: Binding of TFAP2C homodimers to the EGFR gene promoter 
          region stimulates EGFR transcription and may play an important role in
          the etiology of luminal breast cancer (Park et al. 2015, de Andrade et
          al. 2016).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-8951490
    title: CIN85 dissociates from EGF:p-6Y-EGFR:CBL:Beta-Pix:CDC42:GTP:CIN85
    findings:
      - statement: Active CDC42 and Beta-Pix promote displacement of CIN85 from 
          the CBL complex, a release step that can block CBL clustering.
        supporting_text: High concentrations of active CDC42 (bound to GTP) and 
          Beta-Pix may promote the binding of Beta-Pix to CBL, pushing out the 
          usually preferred binding partner CIN85 (SH3KBP1) from the CBL 
          complex.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9018572
    title: EGFR phosphorylates NOTCH3
    findings:
      - statement: EGFR phosphorylates the NOTCH3 intracellular domain and 
          inhibits NOTCH3-mediated transcription.
        supporting_text: EGFR phosphorylates intracellular domain of NOTCH3 
          (NICD3) on an unknown tyrosine residue. EGFR signaling inhibits 
          NICD3-mediated transcription.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9018573
    title: NOTCH3 binds activated EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: NOTCH3 intracellular domain binds activated EGFR, and this 
          binding is inhibited by erlotinib.
        supporting_text: The intracellular domain of NOTCH3 (NICD3) 
          co-immunoprecipitates with ligand activated, autophosphorylated EGFR. 
          Binding of NOTCH3 to EGFR is inhibited by erlotinib treatment, which 
          prevents EGFR activation (Arasada et al. 2014).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9609689
    title: HCMV Binds to the Host Cell via heparan sulfate proteoglycans (HSPG)
    findings:
      - statement: HCMV entry occurs by fusion or endocytosis, with a pentameric
          complex facilitating entry into endothelial and epithelial cells.
        supporting_text: Viral attachment and penetration of Human 
          Cytomegalovirus (HCMV) occurs either via direct HCMV fusion with the 
          cell membrane or via endocytosis. The endocytic mechanism occurs with  
          cell types including endothelial and epithelial cells, where the 
          pentameric viral protein complex, gH:gL:p128:p130:p131A, facilitates 
          entry.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9610867
    title: HCMV Binds Host Cell Receptor - Endocytic Pathway
    findings:
      - statement: HCMV can enter via endocytosis in endothelial and epithelial 
          cells using the pentameric gH:gL:p128:p130:p131A complex.
        supporting_text: Viral attachment and penetration of Human 
          Cytomegalovirus (HCMV) occurs either via direct HCMV fusion with the 
          cell membrane or via endocytosis. The endocytic mechanism occurs with  
          cell types including endothelial and epithelial cells, where the 
          pentameric viral protein complex, gH:gL:p128:p130:p131A, facilitates 
          entry.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9611147
    title: Endocytic Uptake of HCMV Virion
    findings:
      - statement: HCMV enters epithelial and endothelial cells via endocytic 
          uptake and is released by low-pH-dependent fusion with endosomal 
          membranes.
        supporting_text: Once the  pentameric viral protein complex, 
          gH:gL:p128:p130:p131A, facilitates attchment of the Human 
          Cytomegalovirus (HCMV) endocytic uptake allows the virion to enter 
          epithelial and endothelial cells. The virion is released from the 
          endocytic vesicle by low-pH-dependent fusion of the virion coat with 
          endosomes membrane.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9611158
    title: Fusion of HCMV Envelope with Plasma Membrane
    findings:
      - statement: HCMV fuses with the cell membrane after initial attachment to
          heparan sulfate proteoglycans.
        supporting_text: Once Human cytomegalovirus (HCMV) initial attachs to 
          cell surface heparan sulfate proteoglycans (HSPGs), the virus fuses 
          with thecell membrane.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9625482
    title: PTK2 binds activated EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: PTK2 (FAK) binds activated EGFR.
        supporting_text: PTK2 (also known as FAK, focal adhesion kinase) binds 
          to the activated EGFR receptor as assessed by affinity chromatography 
          and co-immunoprecipitation (Sieg et al, 2000; Thelemann et al, 2005; 
          Liu et al, 2010).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9625487
    title: PTK2 autophosphorylates downstream of EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: EGFR-dependent signaling enhances FAK autophosphorylation at 
          Y397.
        supporting_text: Stimulation of cells with either E2 (beta-estradiol), 
          tamoxifen or G1 (a GPER1 agonist) enhances EGFR-dependent FAK 
          autophosphorylation at Y397 (Sieg et al, 2000; Liu et al, 2010; Tsai 
          et al, 2013).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9634702
    title: LINC01139 promotes phosphorylation of HIF1A by LRRK2
    findings:
      - statement: LRRK2 recruited via LINC01139 to phosphorylated GPNMB 
          phosphorylates HIF1A at S797.
        supporting_text: LRRK2 serine/threonine kinase, activated via long 
          non-coding RNA LINC01139 (LINK-A) mediated recruitment to 
          phosphorylated GPNMB (bound to HBEGF-activated EGFR), phosphorylates 
          hypoxia inducible factor 1 alpha (HIF1A) at serine residue S797.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9664567
    title: ERBB2 KD mutants heterodimerize
    findings:
      - statement: Multiple ERBB2 kinase domain mutants are reported to form 
          heterodimers with EGFR.
        supporting_text: "The following ERBB2 KD mutants were directly or indirectly
          shown to form heterodimers with EGFR:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9664588
    title: ERBB2 KD mutants trans-autophosphorylate
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 kinase domain mutants undergo trans-autophosphorylation
          in the presence of EGFR.
        supporting_text: "The following ERBB2 KD mutants were shown to undergo trans-autophosphorylation
          in the presence of EGFR:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9664918
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 KD mutants and EGFR bind 
      GRB2:GAB1
    findings:
      - statement: Phosphorylated ERBB2 KD mutant:EGFR heterodimers are assumed 
          to bind GRB2:GAB1, like wild-type ERBB2:EGFR.
        supporting_text: "Phosphorylated heterodimers of the following ERBB2 KD mutants
          with EGFR are assumed to, like the wild type ERBB2:EGFR heterodimer, bind
          to the GRB2:GAB1 complex:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9664933
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 KD mutants and EGFR, in complex 
      with GRB2:GAB1, bind PI3K
    findings:
      - statement: For EGFR-binding ERBB2 KD mutants, GRB2:GAB1 binding is 
          assumed to recruit PI3K.
        supporting_text: "For the following EGFR-binding ERBB2 KD mutants that activate
          PI3K/AKT signaling, it is assumed that, like the wild type ERBB2:EGFR heterodimer,
          binding to the GRB2:GAB1 adaptor complex leads to recruitment of the PI3K
          complex:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9664940
    title: PI3K bound to phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 KD mutants and 
      EGFR converts PIP2 to PIP3
    findings:
      - statement: EGFR-binding ERBB2 KD mutant heterodimers are assumed to 
          drive PI3K-mediated conversion of PIP2 to PIP3.
        supporting_text: "For the following EGFR-binding ERBB2 KD mutants that were
          shown to activate PI3K/AKT signaling, it is assumed that heterodimers of
          these mutants with EGFR, like the wild type ERBB2:EGFR heterodimer, bind
          to the PI3K complex through GRB2:GAB1, leading to conversion of PIP2 to
          PIP3:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9664950
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 KD mutants bind SHC1
    findings:
      - statement: Based on RAS/RAF/MAPK activation, phosphorylated ERBB2 KD 
          mutant heterodimers are assumed to bind SHC1.
        supporting_text: "Based on downstream activation of RAS/RAF/MAPK cascade,
          it is assumed that phosphorylated heterodimers of the following ERBB2 KD
          mutants, like phosphorylated heterodimers of the wild type ERBB2, bind to
          SHC1:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9664976
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 KD mutants phosphorylate SHC1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 KD mutant heterodimers that activate RAS/RAF/MAPK are 
          assumed to bind and phosphorylate SHC1.
        supporting_text: "For the following ERBB2 KD mutants that were shown to activate
          RAS/RAF/MAPK signaling, it is assumed that they, like phosphorylated heterodimers
          of the wild type ERBB2, bind to SHC1 and phosphorylate it:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9664983
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 KD mutants recruit GRB2:SOS1 
      through SHC1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 KD mutant heterodimers are assumed to recruit GRB2:SOS1
          via SHC1 after SHC1 phosphorylation.
        supporting_text: "For the following ERBB2 KD mutants that were shown to activate
          RAS/RAF/MAPK signaling, it is assumed that they, like phosphorylated heterodimers
          of the wild type ERBB2, bind to and phosphorylate SHC1, leading to recruitment
          of the GRB2:SOS1 complex:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9664991
    title: RAS activation by SOS1 bound to phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 
      KD mutants
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 KD mutant heterodimers are assumed to recruit GRB2:SOS1
          and activate RAS via nucleotide exchange.
        supporting_text: "For the following ERBB2 KD mutants that were shown to activate
          RAS/RAF/MAPK signaling, it is assumed that they, like phosphorylated heterodimers
          of the wild type ERBB2, bind to and phosphorylate SHC1, leading to recruitment
          of the GRB2:SOS1 complex and activating guanyl-nucleotide exchange on RAS:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665000
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 KD mutants and EGFR bind 
      GRB2:SOS1
    findings:
      - statement: EGFR-binding ERBB2 KD mutant heterodimers are assumed to 
          directly bind GRB2:SOS1.
        supporting_text: "The following EGFR-binding ERBB2 KD mutants that were shown
          to activate RAS/RAF/MAPK signaling, evidenced by activating phosphorylation
          of ERKs (MAPK1 and MAPK3), are assumed to, like the wild type ERBB2:EGFR
          heterodimer, directly bind to the GRB2:SOS1 complex:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665009
    title: RAS activation by SOS1 bound to phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 
      KD mutants and EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: EGFR-binding ERBB2 KD mutant heterodimers are assumed to 
          recruit GRB2:SOS1 and activate RAS via nucleotide exchange.
        supporting_text: "The following EGFR-binding ERBB2 KD mutants that were shown
          to activate RAS/RAF/MAPK signaling, evidenced by activating phosphorylation
          of ERKs (MAPK1 and MAPK3), are assumed to, like the wild type ERBB2:EGFR
          heterodimer, directly bind to the GRB2:SOS1 complex, leading to activating
          guanyl nucleotide exchange on RAS:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665032
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 KD mutants and EGFR 
      phosphorylate PLCG1
    findings:
      - statement: EGFR-binding ERBB2 KD mutants that activate PLCG1 are assumed
          to recruit and phosphorylate PLCG1.
        supporting_text: "It is assumed that the following EGFR-binding ERBB2 mutants
          that were shown to activate PLCG1 (PLCgamma-1) signaling, evidenced by activating
          phosphorylation of PLCG1, recruit and phosphorylate PLCG1:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665034
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 KD mutants and EGFR bind PLCG1
    findings:
      - statement: Phosphorylated ERBB2 KD mutant:EGFR heterodimers are assumed 
          to bind PLCG1, similar to wild-type ERBB2:EGFR.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that, like the wild type ERBB2:EGFR 
          heterodimer, phosphorylated heterodimers of these ERBB2 KD mutants and
          EGFR recruit PLCG1.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665388
    title: ERBB2 ECD mutants heterodimerize with EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutants G309A, G309E, and S310F preferentially 
          heterodimerize with EGFR.
        supporting_text: The functionally studied ERBB2 ECD mutants, ERBB2 G309A
          (Bose et al. 2013), ERBB2 G309E (Greulich et al. 2012) and ERBB2 S310F
          (Greulich et al. 2012) seem to preferntially heterodimerize with EGFR.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665389
    title: Heterodimers of ERBB2 ECD mutants and EGFR trans-autophosphorylate
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutant heterodimers trans-autophosphorylate, with 
          S310F showing stronger C-tail phosphorylation than G309A or G309E.
        supporting_text: ERBB2 S310F shows stronger activation of downstream 
          signaling than ERBB2 G309A and ERBB2 G309E, and is hyperphosphorylated
          on tyrosine residues in the C-tail (Greulich et al. 2012), while the 
          C-tail phosphorylation of ERBB2 G309A (Bose et al. 2013) and ERBB2 
          G309E (Greulich et al. 2012) is comparable to the wild type ERBB2.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665404
    title: RAS guanyl nucleotide exchange mediated by the p-6Y- ERBB2 ECD 
      mutants:EGF:p-6Y-EGFR:p-SHC1:GRB2:SOS1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutant heterodimers are assumed to recruit 
          GRB2:SOS1 via SHC1, activating RAS signaling.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2
          ECD mutants and EGFR, like phosphorylated heterodimers of the wild 
          type ERBB2, can recruit the GRB2:SOS1 complex through phosphorylated 
          SHC1, leading to  guanyl nucleotide exchange on RAS and activation of 
          RAS signaling.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665406
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 ECD mutants and EGFR 
      phosphorylate SHC1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutant heterodimers are assumed to bind and 
          phosphorylate SHC1.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2
          ECD mutants and EGFR, like phosphorylated heterodimers of the wild 
          type ERBB2, can bind to and phosphorylate SHC1.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665407
    title: PI3K bound to phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 ECD mutants and 
      EGFR converts PIP2 to PIP3
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutant heterodimers are assumed to recruit PI3K via
          GRB2:GAB1, leading to PIP2 to PIP3 conversion.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2
          ECD mutants and EGFR, like the wild type heterodimers of ERBB2 and 
          EGFR, can bind to the GRB2:GAB1 complex, leading to recruitment of the
          PI3K complex, which results in conversion of PIP2 to PIP3 and 
          activation of the AKT signaling.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665408
    title: RAS activation by SOS1 bound to phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 
      ECD mutants and EGFR through GRB2
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutant heterodimers are assumed to recruit 
          GRB2:SOS1 directly to activate RAS.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2
          ECD mutants and EGFR, like phosphorylated heterodimers of the wild 
          type ERBB2, can directly recruit the GRB2:SOS1 complex, leading to  
          guanyl nucleotide exchange on RAS and activation of RAS signaling.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665409
    title: GRB2:SOS1 binds to phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 ECD mutants 
      and EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutant heterodimers are assumed to recruit 
          GRB2:SOS1.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2
          ECD mutants and EGFR, like phosphorylated heterodimers of the wild 
          type ERBB2, can directly recruit the GRB2:SOS1 complex.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665410
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 ECD mutants and EGFR bind PLCG1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutant heterodimers are assumed to bind PLCG1.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that heterodimers of ERBB2 ECD mutants 
          and EGFR, like the wild type heterodimers of ERBB2 and EGFR, bind to 
          PLCG1.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665411
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 ECD mutants and EGFR 
      phosphorylate PLCG1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutant heterodimers are assumed to bind and 
          phosphorylate PLCG1, activating PLCG1 signaling.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that heterodimers of ERBB2 ECD mutants 
          and EGFR, like the wild type heterodimers of ERBB2 and EGFR, bind to 
          and phosphorylated PLCG1, leading to activation of PLCG1 signaling.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665413
    title: 'Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 ECD mutants and EGFR recruit GRB2:SOS1
      through SHC1 '
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutant heterodimers are assumed to recruit 
          GRB2:SOS1 via SHC1.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2
          ECD mutants and EGFR, like phosphorylated heterodimers of the wild 
          type ERBB2, can recruit the GRB2:SOS1 complex through phosphorylated 
          SHC1.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665415
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 ECD mutants and EGFR, in complex
      with GRB2:GAB1, bind PI3K
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutant heterodimers are assumed to bind GRB2:GAB1 
          and recruit PI3K.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2
          ECD mutants and EGFR, like the wild type heterodimers of ERBB2 and 
          EGFR, can bind to the GRB2:GAB1 complex, leading to the recruitment of
          the PI3K complex.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665416
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 ECD mutants and EGFR bind SHC1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutant heterodimers are assumed to bind SHC1.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2
          ECD mutants and EGFR, like phosphorylated heterodimers of the wild 
          type ERBB2, bind to SHC1.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665417
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 ECD mutants and EGFR bind 
      GRB2:GAB1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 ECD mutant heterodimers are assumed to bind GRB2:GAB1.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2
          ECD mutants and EGFR, like the wild type heterodimers of ERBB2 and 
          EGFR, can bind to the GRB2:GAB1 complex.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665697
    title: ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutants hetrodimerize

          form heterodimers with EGFR and ERBB3.
        supporting_text: "Based on trans-autophosphorylation of ERBB2 and its dimerization
          partners EGFR and ERBB3, the following ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutants are assumed
          to form heterodimers with EGFR and ERBB3:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665698
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutants and EGFR bind 
      GRB2:SOS1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutant heterodimers with EGFR are assumed to 
          directly bind GRB2:SOS1.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that heterodimers of ERBB2 TMD/JMD 
          mutants and EGFR, like the wild type ERBB2:EGFR heterodimers, directly
          bind to GRB:SOS1 complex.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665699
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutants recruit 
      GRB2:SOS1 through SHC1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutant heterodimers are assumed to bind and 
          phosphorylate SHC1, recruiting GRB2:SOS1.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that heterodimers of ERBB2 TMD/JMD 
          mutants, like the wild type ERBB2 heterodimers, bind to and 
          phosphorylate SHC1, leading to the recruitment of the GRB2:SOS1 
          complex.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665700
    title: RAS activation by SOS1 bound to phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 
      TMD/JMD mutants
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutant heterodimers are assumed to recruit 
          GRB2:SOS1 and activate RAS via nucleotide exchange.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that heterodimers of ERBB2 TMD/JMD 
          mutants, like the wild type ERBB2 heterodimers, bind to and 
          phosphorylate SHC1, leading to the recruitment of the GRB2:SOS1 
          complex and activation of RAS through guanyl nucleotide exchange.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665701
    title: Phosphorylated ERBB2 TMD/JMD heterodimers bind SHC1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutant heterodimers are assumed to bind SHC1.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that heterodimers of ERBB2 TMD/JMD 
          mutants, like the wild type ERBB2 heterodimers, bind SHC1.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665704
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutants and EGFR 
      phosphorylate PLCG1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 R678Q:EGFR heterodimers are assumed to bind and 
          phosphorylate PLCG1, activating PLCG1 signaling.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that the heterodimer of ERBB2 R678Q and 
          EGFR, like the wild type ERBB2:EGFR heterodimer, binds to and 
          phosphorylates PLCG1, leading to activation of PLCgamma1 signaling.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665705
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutants phosphorylate 
      SHC1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutant heterodimers are assumed to bind and 
          phosphorylate SHC1.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that heterodimers of ERBB2 TMD/JMD 
          mutants, like the wild type ERBB2 heterodimers, bind to and 
          phosphorylate SHC1.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665706
    title: Phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutants and EGFR bind 
      PLCG1
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 R678Q:EGFR heterodimers are assumed to bind PLCG1.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that the heterodimer of ERBB2 R678Q and 
          EGFR, like the wild type ERBB2:EGFR heterodimer, binds PLCG1.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665707
    title: RAS activation by SOS1 bound to phosphorylated heterodimers of ERBB2 
      TMD/JMD mutants and EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutant heterodimers with EGFR are assumed to 
          directly bind GRB2:SOS1 and activate RAS.
        supporting_text: It is assumed that heterodimers of ERBB2 TMD/JMD 
          mutants and EGFR, like the wild type ERBB2:EGFR heterodimers, directly
          bind to GRB:SOS1 complex, resulting in activation of RAS signaling to 
          guanyl nucleotide exchange on RAS.
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9665709
    title: ERBB2 TMD/JMD heterodimers trans-autophosphorylate
    findings:
      - statement: ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutants show C-tail tyrosine phosphorylation 
          and can phosphorylate EGFR/ERBB3 C-tail residues in heterodimers.
        supporting_text: "Phosphorylation of tyrosine residues in the C-tail of ERBB2
          was shown for the following ERBB2 TMD/JMD mutants:"
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9674531
    title: AAMP binds EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: AAMP binds the intracellular domain of EGFR and promotes EGFR
          dimerization, trans-autophosphorylation, and downstream ERK 
          activation.
        supporting_text: AAMP (Angio-associated migratory cell protein) binds to
          EGFR. The interaction involves the intracellular domain of EGFR. AAMP 
          binding, through an unknown mechanism, promotes EGFR dimerization, 
          trans-autophosphorylation and downstream signaling, leading to 
          activation of ERKs (MAPK1 and MAPK3) and expression of cyclin D1 
          (CCND1).
  - id: Reactome:R-HSA-9851407
    title: FAM83B, (FAM83A, FAM83D) bind EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: FAM83B binds EGFR via K230 and stimulates basal and 
          EGF-induced EGFR trans-autophosphorylation before dissociating.
        supporting_text: Both recombinant and endogenous EGFR and FAM83B form a 
          complex. The lysine residue K230 of FAM83B, conserved in other FAM83 
          family members, including FAM83A and FAM83D, is needed for binding to 
          EGFR and stimulation of EGFR signaling. Through a mechanism that has 
          not been elucidated, FAM83B stimulates basal and EGF-induced EGFR 
          trans-autophosphorylation but dissociates from autophosphorylated EGFR
          (Cipriano et al. 2014).
  - id: Reactome:R-NUL-1248744
    title: Shc1 binds phosphorylated ERBB2:EGFR heterodimers
    findings:
      - statement: Shc1 binds phosphorylated ERBB2:EGFR heterodimers.
        supporting_text: Shc1 binds phosphorylated ERBB2:EGFR heterodimers in 
          engineered mouse 32D cells (Pinkas-Kramarski et al. 1996).
  - id: Reactome:R-NUL-1251923
    title: Plcg1 binds P-ERBB2:P-EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: Mouse PLCgamma1 is phosphorylated by human recombinant ERBB2 
          expressed in mouse fibroblasts.
        supporting_text: Mouse phospholipase C gamma 1 is phosphorylated by 
          human recombinant ERBB2 exogenously expressed in mouse fibroblasts.
  - id: Reactome:R-NUL-1251929
    title: Plcg1 phosphorylation by P-ERBB2:P-EGFR
    findings:
      - statement: Mouse PLCgamma1 is phosphorylated by human recombinant ERBB2 
          expressed in mouse fibroblasts.
        supporting_text: Mouse phospholipase C gamma 1 is phosphorylated by 
          human recombinant ERBB2 exogenously expressed in mouse fibroblasts.
  - id: file:human/EGFR/EGFR-deep-research-falcon.md
    title: Deep research report on EGFR
    findings: []
core_functions:
  - description: epidermal growth factor binding and signal transduction through
      transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase activity
    supported_by:
      - reference_id: PMID:12297050
        supporting_text: Crystal structure of the complex of human epidermal 
          growth factor and receptor extracellular domains
      - reference_id: PMID:12297049
        supporting_text: Crystal structure of a truncated epidermal growth 
          factor receptor extracellular domain bound to transforming growth 
          factor alpha
      - reference_id: PMID:18042729
        supporting_text: Epidermal growth factor receptor juxtamembrane region 
          regulates allosteric tyrosine kinase activation
      - reference_id: PMID:19563760
        supporting_text: Mechanism for activation of the EGF receptor catalytic 
          domain by the juxtamembrane segment
    molecular_function:
      id: GO:0004714
      label: transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase activity
    directly_involved_in:
      - id: GO:0007173
        label: epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway
      - id: GO:0043410
        label: positive regulation of MAPK cascade
      - id: GO:0000165
        label: MAPK cascade
    locations:
      - id: GO:0005886
        label: plasma membrane
      - id: GO:0016020
        label: membrane
    substrates:
      - id: GO:0048408
        label: epidermal growth factor binding
  - description: autophosphorylation activity mediating receptor dimerization 
      and downstream signaling activation
    supported_by:
      - reference_id: PMID:18042729
        supporting_text: Epidermal growth factor receptor juxtamembrane region 
          regulates allosteric tyrosine kinase activation
      - reference_id: PMID:19563760
        supporting_text: Mechanism for activation of the EGF receptor catalytic 
          domain by the juxtamembrane segment
    molecular_function:
      id: GO:0004714
      label: transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase activity
    directly_involved_in:
      - id: GO:0018108
        label: peptidyl-tyrosine phosphorylation
      - id: GO:0046777
        label: protein autophosphorylation
    locations:
      - id: GO:0005886
        label: plasma membrane
